meanings.definition: To mark off or divide with rows of checks or squares.
meanings.sent1: I will checkrow the garden to separate the flowers from the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The farmer decided to checkrow the field to keep the crops organized.
meanings.sent3: The ants checkrowed the picnic blanket, creating a neat pattern of crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The artist checkrowed the canvas with colorful squares, creating a unique design.
meanings.sent5: Checkrowing the map helped us navigate the maze-like streets more easily.

meanings.definition: A method of planting crops in which the seeds are sown in rows with intervals between.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used checkrowing to plant the corn seeds in straight lines.
meanings.sent2: Checkrowing is a common technique used in agriculture to ensure proper spacing of crops.
meanings.sent3: The checkrowing of the seeds resembled soldiers standing in formation.
meanings.sent4: The checkrowing of the flowers in the garden created a beautiful pattern from above.
meanings.sent5: The checkrowing of the wheat seeds made the field look like a giant patchwork quilt.
